meanings.definition: The position or office of a judge.
meanings.sent1: Her dream was to attain a judgeship and serve justice in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: The judgeship required impartiality and a deep understanding of the law.
meanings.sent3: When the cat claimed the judgeship of the house, chaos ensued in the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent4: In the kingdom of books, the judgeship belonged to the wise librarian.
meanings.sent5: The judgeship shone like a beacon of fairness in the legal system.

meanings.definition: The term of office of a judge.
meanings.sent1: His judgeship was marked by integrity and dedication to upholding the law.
meanings.sent2: The judgeship of the honorable judge ended after ten years of service.
meanings.sent3: The judgeship of the teddy bear in the toy court was a short but memorable reign.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set on his judgeship, he reflected on the cases that had crossed his desk.
meanings.sent5: The judgeship passed from one generation to the next, a legacy of honor and duty.
